tool.name: Get.otulist
tool.description: Get otus for each distance in a otu list
tool.command:
echo 'get.otulist( list=$otu, #if $label: label=${ str($label).replace(",","-") }, #end if sort=$sort )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur &&
## move output files to correct destination prefix="$otu" && mv mothur.*.logfile "$logfile" && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.otu .

param.name: label
param.label: label - select OTU distance labels
param.help: By default, uses all if none are selected.

param.name: sort
param.label: sort - select the output format
param.help: If otu is selected the output will be otu number followed by the list of names in that otu. If name is selected the output will be a sequence name followed by its otu number

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The get.otulist_ command parses a list file and creates an .otu file for each distance containing 2 columns. The first column is the OTU number the second column is a list of sequences in that OTU.
.. _get.otulist: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Get.otulist
v.1.20.0: Updated to Mothur 1.33
